hero.title: Saferspaces for <1>safer</1> places
hero.subtitle: Saferspaces shifts the principle of safety from the feeling of being threatened to the feeling of being safe

directContactViaQrCode.title:
<0>Anonymous and
easily accessible
directContactViaQrCode.text: By scanning location-based QR codes on the saferspaces posters, contact can be made easily and at a low threshold. This replaces the often challenging step of actively approaching a stranger and asking for help with a low threshold.

digitalAwarenessApproach.title: Take care of those <1>affected</1>
digitalAwarenessApproach.text: With saferspaces, we are shifting the focus from „<1>who</1> did <3>what</3>?“ to „<5>who</5> was <7>affected</7>?“, adopting a modern approach. Our application not only provides immediate assistance to those affected but also offers valuable insights to enhance awareness efforts in specific contexts.

advantages.title:
<0>Benefits of using
saferspaces
advantages.description: The application not only enhances the well-being of visitors, but also promotes sustainable security improvements through its innovative approach.

geoPosition.title:
Direct Location
Transmission
geoPosition.description: All QR codes on saferspaces posters are location-based, allowing our team to quickly identify the exact location of individuals seeking help.

anonymous.title:
Complete
Anonymity
anonymous.description: Contact us without revealing any personal information; your privacy is fully protected.

noApp.title:
No App
Download Required
noApp.description: Saferspaces operates via the web, so visitors do not need to download an app before an event.

geoFencing.title: Geofencing
geoFencing.description: Thanks to the geofencing function, the system recognises whether the person reporting is in the usage context.

qrCode.title:
Easy
to Reach
qrCode.description: Staff can be contacted by scanning a QR code, shifting from an active to a low-threshold approach for reaching out.

data.title:

data.description: Non-personal metadata such as time, incident type and location is collected to assess, and analyse the security landscape.

language.title:
Automated
Multilingual Support
language.description: Upon scanning, the system automatically detects the language of the user's mobile device and displays the content accordingly (DE/EN).

integration.title:
Location-
Independent Solution
integration.description: Messages can be sent from any location using both an individual venue link and simple integration into existing apps.

reporting.title: Reporting tool
reporting.description: If a person reports via the venue link and is not in the usage context, an anonymous message can be sent at any time via the reporting tool.

forARespectfulSociety.title: For a <1>respectful</1> society
forARespectfulSociety.text: Saferspaces complements existing safety concepts with an approach that promotes the well-being of all and actively encourages respectful coexistence. Based on the principle of being there when help is needed, the application can provide targeted assistance on site in various emergency situations:

discrimination.title: Discrimination
discrimination.description: If people are being discriminated against because of their gender, ethnicity, religion, or physical or mental disability, it's important to provide an easily accessible way for them to report it.

sexualAssault.title: Sexual Assault
sexualAssault.description: The dark figure of sexual offenses is alarmingly high. The saferspaces infrastructure offers those affected the opportunity to receive immediate and trained support.

generalIncidents.title: General Incidents
generalIncidents.description: Whether it’s issues like lack of accessibility, losing a child in a crowd, or experiencing a panic attack, the location-based reporting feature enables quick and easy access to help.

abuseOfPower.title: Abuse of Power
abuseOfPower.description: In instances of power abuse or misuse of authority, individuals can use saferspaces to anonymously report incidents and seek support, ensuring protection from personal repercussions, particularly within the workplace.

escalationsOfViolence.title: Escalation of Violence
escalationsOfViolence.description: Saferspaces' location-based reporting feature enables an immediate response to help those affected.

notification.title: Medical Emergency
notification.description: In the event of a medical emergency, location-based reporting saves valuable time.

customerFeedback.title: Customer <1>feedback</1>
customerFeedback.description: Since 2021, our application has been used effectively across sectors including nightlife, professional sports, major events, and corporate environments, fostering a culture of respect and promoting safer environments.

quotes.text: By using saferspaces, we will avoid unnecessary loss of time in determining the location of the emergency due to radio interference, incomprehensible announcements, etc. and thus raise the standard of security and help in the stadium
quotes.name: Sven Brux
quotes.position: Head of Matchday Organization & Fan Affairs

quotes.text: The collaboration of saferspaces and the city of Kiel enables a safer and democratic festival and the promotion of democracy on the Kieler Woche.
quotes.name: Vanessa-Zoe Vitsilakis

quotes.text: We believe that our audience, through the approach and use of the app, is more attentive to one another.
quotes.name: Fenja Möller

quotes.text: The people who used the codes to get help were surprised at how quickly and reliably help arrived on site.
quotes.name: Sandra Lechtenböhmer

contact.title: Let's get in <1>touch</1>
contact.description: Are you interested in using saferspaces? We are happy to introduce you to the diverse functions of our application. Book a short and free appointment here. We're looking forward to meet you!

hero.title: Security reimagined
hero.subtitle: Saferspaces enhances existing security concepts with an innovative software solution that addresses current challenges and enables quick and respectful assistance in real-time.

safer.title:
We create
safer places
safer.text: Our application creates a positive impact at events, sports clubs, festivals, clubs, trade fairs, companies and conferences - wherever people come together in large numbers.

advantages.title:
Saferspaces provides
extra value
advantages.text: There are various advantages to using saferspaces, both for those affected and for those who provide the infrastructure for visitors.

slides.title: Reduces costs
slides.description: The visibility and immediate accessibility of teams deployed to help those affected is essential. The application makes this accessibility possible at any time, even for smaller teams from any location.

slides.title: Provides valuable data
slides.description: The anonymized data (when, what happened, where) provides valuable insights into existing security gaps and can contribute to a sustainable improvement in the given security situation.

slides.title: Raises standards
slides.description: With the help of the Saferspaces infrastructure, your own safety standards are improved and upgraded in the long term through an innovative and time-saving approach.

slides.title: Strengthens the sense of security
slides.description: The certainty of being able to receive support from any location at any time has a positive effect on the sense of security of employees and visitors.

slides.title: Reduces the risk of escalation
slides.description: Thanks to the location-based notifications, unnecessary loss of time is avoided and escalations can be prevented through the possibility of targeted support.

slides.title: Reduces staff turnover
slides.description: The direct reporting function, which also benefits employees, prevents situations of excessive stress and improves well-being within the workplace.

slides.title: Increases revenue
slides.description: The holistic approach to safety that comes with using Saferspaces appeals to a large target group, which can lead to increasing revenue from a growing number of visitors.

setup.title:
Quick and
easy Set up
setup.text: It only takes a few simple steps and a few minutes to set up the infrastructure for our application.

steps.title: Check-in
steps.description: During a short check-in, you tell us in what context the saferspaces app will be used.

steps.title: Infrastructure Setup
steps.description: In our management, we set up the infrastructure for your specific context within a few minutes and provide you with the finished print files for the posters.

steps.title: Onboarding
steps.description: During a short onboarding session, we give the trained team an introduction to using the application. Then you’re ready to go!

steps.title: Printing and Placing
steps.description: To ensure that people can contact the trained team via the posters, these need to be printed in advance and placed visibly on site.

mustHaves.title:
Must-haves for
using saferspaces
mustHaves.text: To use saferspaces effectively, certain basic requirements must be met to ensure the best possible support for those affected. For more information on how to use our application ideally, click <2>here</2>.

steps.title: Staff
steps.description: The use of saferspaces requires staff who are specifically deployed to support those affected. It is also important to have women on the team to ensure the best possible support for female victims of sexual assault.

steps.title: Stable Internet
steps.description: Since saferspaces is a web-based software application, a stable internet connection (at least for the staff) is essential for successful use.

steps.title: Safespace
steps.description: To ensure the best possible support for those affected, retreat rooms can make a significant contribution. They provide protection and calm in overwhelming situations to process experiences.

pricing.title: Fair & transparent prices
pricing.text_1: Our goal is for saferspaces to contribute to a safer and more respectful environment in as many places as possible. Therefore, we have chosen a pricing model that makes it affordable for smaller venues to use.
pricing.text_2: In addition to the usage fee, which is either one-time or monthly depending on the context, there is only a one-time fee for onboarding.
pricing.text_3: In principle: If you are hesitant to use the application because of cost, please contact us.
pricing.note: With the price calculator, you can easily and transparently calculate the usage fee.
pricing.priceNote: All prices are subject to an additional 19% VAT.

hero.title: <0>Questions</0> about the use of saferspaces
hero.subtitle: If you have any further questions about the use of saferspaces, please email us at kontakt@saferspaces.io

questions.question: Do I have to download an app to use saferspaces?
questions.answer: Our approach ensures that asking for help is as accessible and anonymous as possible. Therefore, visitors simply need to scan QR codes to contact the awareness team.

questions.question: Do I have to share my location?
questions.answer: Since each code in the saferspaces system is linked to a specific location, visitors do not need to provide their own location information.

questions.question: What should I do if I want to move away from the code?
questions.answer: If a person wants to move away from the code, location sharing can be enabled within the chat. This allows the awareness team to locate and assist the person even away from the code's initial location.

questions.question: What should I do if the phone camera needs to be covered in the club or at events?
questions.answer: In contexts where there is a rule to cover phone cameras, this rule is waived exclusively for the use of saferspaces.

questions.question: How do I, as a visitor, find out about the possibility of using the codes?
questions.answer: At all locations where saferspaces is offered, you will find signs at the entrance as well as in the various rooms that point out the application and display the codes. Some clubs also already work with an awareness message at the entrance. This means that in addition to the generally applicable rules, saferspaces is also briefly explained.

questions.question: Do I have to describe my situation in the chat?
questions.answer: The chat is just an offer that you can use. If you don't write anything in the chat, the awareness team will make its way to you even without a message.

questions.question: What is the advantage of QR codes?
questions.answer: As well as providing an anonymous way of reporting a situation, the codes also act as a direct bridge to people trained to deal with critical situations and assist those affected. Visitors do not have to approach strangers in the hope of not overwhelming them and receiving the appropriate response. In addition, unlike other approaches, visitors do not have to download an app or provide a large amount of personal information.

questions.question: Can I also use saferspaces for one-time events?
questions.answer: Saferspaces can be used for one-time events as well as permanently. Its straightforward and focused approach means that little preparation is required to set up the infrastructure, even at short notice. To ensure that trained personnel are available to deal with potential incidents on-site, we can also assist with the provision of suitable awareness personnel.

questions.question: What costs will I incur as the organiser?
questions.answer: Costs are based on the maximum capacity of the venue. There is also a one-off set-up fee, which is used to test the set-up with the relevant personnel, to answer any final questions and to ensure that trained personnel are available to deal with any incidents and to assist those affected.

questions.question: What is the advantage of QR codes?
questions.answer: In addition to providing your guests with an easy way to contact the awareness team, the codes offer several key advantages. According to initial reports, their very presence in the venue, together with descriptions of their function, has already had a positive effect on the atmosphere among visitors. Visitors recognise a comprehensive security concept, and opportunists are deterred from potential misconduct. Furthermore, the QR codes offer the advantage that guests only need a mobile device to benefit from the concept; there is no need to download a separate app. In addition, no location information is required from the guests to locate the offenders or observers, as each code stores its own unique location, which is transmitted to the team when scanned.

questions.question: What kind of infrastructure do I need to provide saferspaces?
questions.answer: The most important requirement is reliable internet coverage to ensure that scans reliably reach the awareness team. Depending on this, as providers of saferspaces, you only need a tablet (recommended) or phone to coordinate incoming cases. In addition to the application, we are happy to assist you with the infrastructure and provision of hardware. The whole system consists of three components: Administration, where the codes for the event are generated and the desired features (chat, location sharing, emergency number, etc.) can be configured. An application for the awareness teams, where incidents are received and coordinated. Codes for visitors and staff to report unsafe situations. In addition to the technology, it is vital that the people handling the incidents are trained to deal with the people involved. If training is required or desired in this area, we can put you in touch with the appropriate initiatives.

questions.question: How do I ensure that the messages are actually seen by staff?
questions.answer: It is important that at least one person remains near the device that displays incoming cases. When someone scans a code, the screen will flash and an alarm will sound for one minute or until the case is acknowledged.

questions.question: How can I be sure that the codes are not being misused?
questions.answer: From our previous deployments, we are pleased to report that there have been no instances of misuse regarding the codes. This success can be attributed to the descriptions on the signs and the specific steps within the application. For example, after scanning, individuals are asked to specify whether they are an observer or someone affected. We also recommend a brief introduction at the entrance, emphasizing the desire for respectful behavior and outlining possible consequences, such as being banned, for not adhering to the rules.

questions.question: Can staff also use the codes if they need support?
questions.answer: It's actually an important part of our approach because many eyes can better ensure the well-being of everyone present. Staff have the option to request assistance, both for their own cases of uncertain situations and for situations they observe. There's the option to scan in before the start of the shift and then just press a button to request help. Staff can also call for help in two ways. Firstly, they can report an unsafe situation so that someone can come to help. Secondly, there's an emergency button for situations where not only the awareness team but also the security staff need to come to help.

questions.question: Requirements for the use of saferspaces
questions.answer:
What does "trained personnel" mean? Essentially, wherever our infrastructure is deployed, there are people who are explicitly there for those who need support in overwhelming situations. These "person-affected oriented personnel" differ from traditional security personnel in that they do not focus on who did what. Awareness teams focus on the people affected by assault and discrimination, shifting the focus to who has been affected and how best to help a person seeking help.

Safe Space
Whenever a person needs acute emotional support, it may be necessary to provide a quiet place to care for and support the individual. These spaces should ideally be sheltered and away from the action.

Staff / Basic Requirements
The team using our application should ideally have previous experience of awareness work. If this is not the case, appropriate training can help to create a person affected-centred team. We are happy to facilitate relevant training from external providers, tailored to the specific context.

Diverse Teams M/F/D
An important requirement is that teams are diverse. As there are often people affected by assault and discrimination, we want to ensure that each team includes people from different backgrounds.

Minimum Age
In addition, we emphasise that individuals working with saferspaces in a person affected-centred way should be at least 23 years old or have extensive experience in awareness work.

Professional Background
Whilst it is desirable for members of the awareness team to have a social, psychological or medical background, this is not a requirement. We value diversity and encourage people from other professional backgrounds to train in awareness work.

Fundamentals
In general, we recommend that all saferspaces users engage in basic awareness work within their own context, beyond solely providing acute assistance to those affected. The aim should be to assist people in acute situations while also focusing on understanding the root causes of discrimination and attacks in their respective contexts, as well as implementing preventive measures. Valuable information can be found, for example, in the following links
https://awareness-institut.net/
https://www.initiative-awareness.de/
